page.title: 01SYNOPSIS OF THE SURVEY AREA
page.content: THE AREA BETWEEN POLEGATE AND HAILSHAM HAS LAND USAGE OF 65% GENERAL FARM LAND, 30% WOODLAND AND 5% HOUSING. THE WOODLAND LIES TO THE N.E. OF POLEGATE AND THE FARMLAND TO THE NORTH EAST AND WEST. THE MAIN WOODLAND AREA IS ABBOTS WOOD WHICH HAS BEEN DEVELOPED AS A LEISURE AREA.IT HAS LOVELY WALKS AND A COARSE FISHING LAKE. THE FARMS ARE ALL SMALL, WITH ARABLE FARMS TO THE WEST AND INCREASINGLY LIVESTOCK FARMS TO THE EAST. THE MAIN SETTLEMENT IS POLEGATE WHICH DEVELOPED FROM THE GROWTH OF THE RAILWAY (the northern line of which is now disused) IN THE LATTER PART OF 1800s.FROM AN ORIGINAL POPULATION OF 6 FAMILIES, THERE ARE NOW @7,500 INHABITANTS.POLEGATE IS ALMOST ENTIRELY RESIDENTIAL. THERE IS ONE PRIMARY SCHOOL & TWO BUSY MAIN ROADS.
